questions.question: Given the volumes below, how much hydraulic fluid will be required to carry out the following operations? Operations: Close then open. Equipment: One annular preventer, Two pipe rams, One blind/shear ram. Volumes: Annular Preventer: 20 gallons to close, 17 gallons to open. Pipe ram: 8 gallons to close, 7 gallons to open. Shear/blind ram: 8 gallons to close, 7 gallons to open.
questions.explanation: Close: 20 + 8 + 8 + 8 = 44 gal. Open: 17 + 7 + 7 + 7 = 38 gal. Total = 82 gallons.

questions.question: On a surface BOP stack, in which position must the valves on the kill line and choke line be placed during drilling?

options.A: Manual valves closed and hydraulic valves open
options.C: Hydraulic valves closed and manual valves open
options.D: Both types closed on kill line and open on choke line

questions.explanation: HCR (hydraulic) valves stay closed for quick automatic closure; manual valves stay open for flow path.

questions.question: There is only one inside BOP with NC38 pin/box connections. Drill string: 3-1/2" drill pipe (NC38), 4-3/4" drill collars (NC35). Which crossover must be on the rig floor while tripping?
questions.explanation: IBOP has NC38 connections. To install on drill collars (NC35), need crossover from NC38 box to NC35 pin.

questions.question: Which statement about an Inside Blowout Preventer is correct?

options.A: It can be opened or closed using a wrench
options.B: It requires a double box sub to be installed
options.C: It allows reverse circulation when installed
options.D: It is opened by pumping drilling fluid down the drill string

questions.explanation: IBOP is opened by pump pressure—a check valve that allows flow down but not up.

questions.question: If a float valve is installed in the string, is it possible to reverse circulate?
questions.explanation: Float valves are one-way check valves allowing flow DOWN only.

questions.question: While drilling, BOP control panel shows: Accumulator 2900 psi falling, Manifold 1200 psi falling, Annular 1000 psi static. BOP not operated, pumps not running. What is the most likely cause?

options.D: A leak in the manifold system
options.E: A leak in the annular system

questions.explanation: Accumulator and manifold both falling but annular static = leak in manifold system downstream of accumulator.

questions.question: Is it true that some annular preventers used as diverters only have a closing line and no opening line?
questions.explanation: Diverter annulars are designed to close and stay closed. Opening is by venting hydraulic pressure.

questions.question: When annular preventers are pressure tested, test pressure may need to be pumped up several times before a good test. Why?

options.B: Annular BOPs always leak at first
options.C: The elastomer is flowing into a new shape

questions.explanation: Annular packing element (elastomer) deforms under pressure to create seal.

questions.question: Which 3-position/4-way valves should be in the OPEN position while drilling? (FIVE ANSWERS)
questions.explanation: All rams and annular should be OPEN while drilling. HCR valves (kill and choke) stay CLOSED.

questions.question: According to API STD 53, accumulator pump systems should charge the system from precharge to RWP within:
questions.explanation: API STD 53 requires pumps to recharge accumulators in 15 minutes maximum.

questions.question: Which BOP functions use hydraulic pressure regulated by the annular pressure regulator?
questions.explanation: Annular regulator controls ONLY annular preventer pressure. Rams use manifold pressure directly.

questions.question: If air pressure gauge on an air-operated remote BOP control panel reads zero, which is true?

options.A: No stack function can be operated
options.B: Annular can be operated from remote
options.C: Choke/kill valves can be operated from remote
options.D: No stack function can be operated from remote panel

questions.explanation: No air = no remote operation. Main unit can still be operated manually.

questions.question: Which statements about 3-position/4-way valves on the hydraulic control unit are true? (TWO ANSWERS)

options.A: Cannot be operated from remote panel

questions.explanation: 3-position valves have 4 hydraulic ports (P, T, A, B). They CAN be operated remotely and manually.

questions.question: What operates the remotely operated valves on the choke line?
questions.explanation: HCR valves are operated by hydraulic fluid from the BOP control unit.

questions.question: While circulating out a gas kick, what determines actual pressure inside the MGS? (TWO ANSWERS)

options.B: Density of fluid in liquid seal

questions.explanation: MGS internal pressure = backpressure from vent line dimensions + flow rate effects.

questions.question: Where should the vacuum degasser suction line be located per best practice?
questions.explanation: Vacuum degasser handles residual gas AFTER MGS has removed bulk gas.

questions.question: In an MGS diagram, which dimensions determine back pressure? D3=Vent diameter, H3=Vent height, H1=Vessel height, D4=Inlet diameter, H2=Dip tube height.
questions.explanation: Backpressure is determined by vent line dimensions—both height and diameter affect friction.

questions.question: Which factors could limit success of a diverter operation during shallow gas? (THREE ANSWERS)

options.A: Rig air pressure of zero psi

questions.explanation: Zero air = can't close diverter. Unlocked dogs = diverter can lift. Weak formation = may fracture.

questions.question: Preparing to run wireline logs on a well with limited overbalance. Safest action?

options.A: Have correct rams for riser/lubricator installed and tested
options.B: Replace blind/shear rams with pipe rams

questions.explanation: Wireline operations with marginal overbalance require wireline-compatible rams installed and tested.

questions.question: Per API STD-53, if manual valve is inside (closest to stack) and HCR valve outside on chokeline, what's the advantage?
questions.explanation: With manual valve inside, you can close it to isolate wellbore pressure, then safely repair the HCR valve.

questions.question: On a Surface BOP space out diagram, which measurement is most important?
questions.explanation: RKB to shear rams determines where to position pipe body (not tool joint) for successful shearing.

questions.question: To verify operability, adjustable chokes shall be operated:
questions.explanation: API STD 53 requires daily operation of adjustable chokes.

questions.question: Per API STD-53, which is true concerning remote adjustable chokes?

options.A: Only main system shall be checked
options.B: Only backup system shall be checked
options.C: Both main and backup systems shall be checked

questions.explanation: Both primary and backup choke actuation systems must be verified operational.

questions.question: Per RP-64, which statement about diverter systems is true?

options.A: Must have capability to vent downwind
options.B: Should include high pressure sealing element
options.C: Vent lines should be small diameter
options.D: Packing should close before vent opens

questions.explanation: Diverters must vent downwind to keep gas away from rig. They're LOW pressure devices with LARGE vent lines.

questions.question: Ram preventer with 5" pipe rams closed. Lights changed, pressures fell/recovered. Volume to close should be 18 gal but flowmeter shows 12 gal. Safest decision?

options.B: Ram has not fully closed on 5" pipe

questions.explanation: 6 gallons short means rams didn't fully close. Never assume flowmeter wrong in safety-critical situations.

questions.question: When could it be necessary to use the kill line on a surface BOP stack? (TWO ANSWERS)
questions.explanation: Bullheading and Lubricate & Bleed pump down kill line. Normal circulation methods use drillstring.

questions.question: BOP stack with various RWP ratings: Annular 5000 psi, others 10000 psi except rotary hose (7500 psi) and downstream chokes (5000 psi). MASP is 7900 psi. What changes needed?

options.B: Replace 7500 psi rotary hose with 10000 psi
options.D: Upgrade downstream choke manifold to 10000 psi

questions.explanation: Annular protected by rams. Rotary hose isolated by safety valves. Downstream of choke sees controlled pressure.

questions.question: When should the diverter be pressure tested?
questions.explanation: Diverters are low-pressure devices. Pressure test annually and after any seal/packer work.

questions.question: When should the diverter be function tested when in use?
questions.explanation: Function test diverter at installation and weekly while in use.

questions.question: If the well starts to flow while running/pulling casing, what could shut the well in?

options.A: Install DPSV and IBOP on casing, close annular
options.B: Install correct size water bushing/swage and valve on casing, close valve then annular or casing rams
options.C: Drop the string and close pipe rams
options.D: Install DPSV on casing and close casing rams

questions.explanation: Casing needs a swage/valve assembly to seal internally. DPSV/IBOP are drillpipe tools.

questions.question: Which statement about Shear Rams is true?

options.A: Larger diameter pistons increase shearing force
options.B: Longer piston strokes increase shearing force

questions.explanation: Force = Pressure × Area. Larger piston diameter = larger area = more force.

questions.question: What makes shear ram closing force greater than pipe ram closing force?

options.C: Ram rod diameter and closing pressure
options.D: Ram rod length and closing pressure

questions.explanation: Shear rams have higher closing ratio than pipe rams. Combined with closing pressure, this generates greater force.

questions.question: While killing a well, MGS liquid seal is blown and gas venting to shaker area. What to do?

options.A: Shut down, shut in well, pump mud into seal, restart at lower rate

questions.explanation: Blown seal = hazardous situation. Must stop, restore seal, restart at lower rate.

questions.question: Using Hydril 13-5/8", 5000 psi annular closing pressure graph, which actions are possible? (TWO ANSWERS)

options.A: Seal 5" pipe at 250 psi well/500 psi closing
options.B: Seal 2-7/8" pipe at 500 psi well/600 psi closing
options.C: Seal 8" DC at 1000 psi well/1000 psi closing
options.D: Seal open hole at 1000 psi well/1150 psi closing
options.E: Seal 2-3/8" pipe at 1000 psi well/700 psi closing

questions.explanation: Per closing pressure graph: 8" DC and open hole at those pressures are within acceptable ranges.

questions.question: BOP: Three 13-5/8" 10000 psi ram preventers, one 13-5/8" 5000 psi annular. Shut in on 5" pipe, SICP 1000 psi. What annular closing pressure is required?
questions.explanation: Per stripping operations chart: 5" pipe at 1000 psi well pressure requires approximately 700-900 psi closing pressure.

questions.question: Subsea BOP: Well shut in but choke line plugged due to barite sag. How to circulate and kill?

options.B: Pump down drillstring up choke line
options.C: Pump down drillstring up kill line
options.D: Pump down kill line up drillstring

questions.explanation: If choke line plugged, use kill line as return path. Pump down drillstring and return up kill line.

questions.question: Subsea BOP with blue pod and yellow pod. How many SPM valves operate to close and open a ram preventer?
questions.explanation: Each pod has 2 SPM valves per function (close and open). With redundant pods: 2 SPM valves × 2 functions = 4 total.

questions.question: Closing a wellbore pressure assisted annular on subsea BOP, which is true?

options.A: Closing pressure greater with 14 ppg mud in riser
options.B: Closing pressure greater with 8.6 ppg seawater in riser

questions.explanation: Heavier mud exerts more hydrostatic on piston, requiring more hydraulic closing pressure.

questions.question: Upper annular close activated from driller's panel on subsea MUX system. Lights change but pressures don't. Cause?
questions.explanation: Lights change (signal received) but pressures don't (no hydraulic action) = solenoid malfunction.

questions.question: Pipe ram close failed on yellow pod. Switched to blue pod, closed successfully. Problem?
questions.explanation: Shuttle valve stuck in position favoring other pod. When switched to blue pod, shuttle moved and function worked.

questions.question: Main purpose of ram locking devices on subsea BOP?

options.C: Lock BOP to wellhead and LMRP to BOP
options.D: Lock rams closed during disconnect or hydraulic failure

questions.explanation: Ram locks mechanically secure rams closed independent of hydraulics. Critical for EDS or hydraulic loss.

questions.question: Which statement about 'Memory Function' on subsea BOP panel is true?

options.A: Indicates malfunction with permanent alarm light
options.B: Indicates previous position before Block was selected

questions.explanation: Memory function stores last commanded position before Block was selected.

questions.question: Surface accumulator precharge is 1200 psi. Water depth 1100 ft, seawater 8.6 ppg. Minimum subsea accumulator precharge?
questions.explanation: Subsea precharge = Surface + Hydrostatic. 1100 × 8.6 × 0.052 = 492 psi. Total = 1200 + 492 = 1692 psi.

questions.question: Which statement about shuttle valves on subsea BOP is correct?

options.C: Isolate control fluid between active and redundant pods

questions.explanation: Shuttle valves allow either pod to operate functions while preventing backflow between pods.

questions.question: Subsea well shut in on upper annular. Both choke lines plugged. How to proceed with kill?

options.A: Hang-off on lower rams, open annular, circulate up lower kill
options.B: Shear pipe and bullhead using upper kill
options.C: With upper annular closed, circulate up lower kill
options.D: With upper annular closed, circulate up upper kill

questions.explanation: Upper kill line exits above upper annular. With annular closed, can circulate up upper kill line.

questions.question: Limitation of using inverted test rams to pressure test subsea BOP?

options.C: String tension will reduce drillpipe collapse pressure
options.D: String tension will increase collapse pressure

questions.explanation: With inverted test rams, pressure on inside of drillpipe combined with string tension reduces collapse resistance.

questions.question: Subsea MUX BOP on drillship. While drilling, low accumulator alarm and flowmeter counting rapidly. No functions activated. Cause?

options.C: Main power fluid line to BOP leaking

questions.explanation: Rapid fluid loss without function activation = leak in supply line.

questions.question: Class 4 BOP stack, annular won't seal. Upper pipe ram activated, manifold drops to 0 psi immediately. Accumulator decreasing, pumps running. Quickest action to shut in?

options.B: Close ram manually with lock screws
options.C: Return upper to open, close lower pipe ram
options.D: Send AD to manually operate stuck selector valve

questions.explanation: Manifold to 0 = selector valve stuck open/bypassing. Return upper to open (stop leak), close lower rams instead.

questions.question: Driller shut in on annular, SICP approaching annular RWP. Tried to close upper pipe ram. Accumulator static 3000 psi, Annular static 1200 psi, Manifold immediately to 0 psi. What problem?

options.A: Leak in hydraulic line to upper pipe ram
options.D: Hydraulic line to upper pipe ram blocked

questions.explanation: Manifold immediately to 0 while accumulator holds 3000 = manifold regulator failed open.

questions.question: Same situation as Q49. What action could driller take next?

options.A: Send AD to operate 3-position valve manually
options.B: Activate bypass function (place bypass valve in high)
options.D: Send AD to tap manifold regulator with hammer

questions.explanation: Bypass function routes accumulator pressure directly to rams, bypassing the failed manifold regulator.

questions.question: Off bottom kick shut in on middle pipe rams. SICP = 5000 psi. Cameron U Type 13-5/8" 15000 psi rams. Closing ratio 8.7:1, Opening ratio 2.3:1. Stripping back, tool joint just above closed rams. Next action?

options.A: Close upper rams, pump 5000 psi between rams, open middle rams
options.B: Close upper rams, activate bypass, open middle rams
options.C: Close upper rams, open middle rams

questions.explanation: At 5000 psi with 2.3:1 opening ratio, wellbore pressure holds rams closed. Must equalize pressure above rams before opening.

questions.question: Need to repair chokeline hydraulic valve while monitoring well on trip tank. Which 2 barriers in place?
questions.explanation: To monitor on trip tank need open flow path (no rams). Manual valve isolates repair zone. Mud is primary barrier.

questions.question: While repairing chokeline HCR valve, well flows and is shut in. Which 2 barriers in place?
questions.explanation: Well flowing with pipe in hole = close pipe rams. Manual valve already closed for repair. Two barriers: lower pipe rams + manual valve.

questions.question: 15K BOP stack. After POOH, HCR valve found leaking. Which 2 barriers for repair?

options.A: Retrievable packer and chokeline manual valve
options.B: Drilling mud and chokeline manual valve
options.C: Retrievable packer and lower pipe rams
options.D: Drilling mud and lower pipe rams

questions.explanation: Out of hole = need mechanical barriers. Retrievable packer provides internal barrier. Lower rams close off annular space.

questions.question: Well shut in with wellbore pressure assisted annular. When should hydraulic closing pressure be reduced per manufacturer recommendations?

options.B: After shut in and pressures have stabilised
options.C: After pump brought to kill rate

questions.explanation: Wait for pressures to stabilize to know actual wellbore pressure. Then reduce closing pressure proportionally.

questions.question: During pressure test, annular closing pressure had to be increased to make seal. Problem?
questions.explanation: Needing higher pressure to seal indicates elastomer losing resilience. Early sign of deterioration.

questions.question: Why are some BOP stacks fitted with a kill line below the lower pipe rams?

options.A: To bullhead with lower rams closed

questions.explanation: Kill line below lower rams allows pumping into wellbore with all rams closed. Essential for bullheading after shearing.

questions.question: BOP: Annular, 5" pipe rams, blind shear rams, drilling spool with choke/kill outlets, variable bore rams. Which operation is possible?

options.A: Strip 5" drill pipe ram to ram
options.B: Strip 6-5/8" drill pipe ram to ram
options.C: Circulate down drillstring up choke line with 6-5/8" pipe
options.D: Bullhead down kill line with lower ram closed

questions.explanation: VBR can seal on 6-5/8" pipe. Can circulate with VBR closed on 6-5/8". Can't strip without matching rams.

questions.question: Which is a recognised method to determine CLF?

options.A: Pump down kill line up choke line, pressure is half CLF
options.B: Pump down kill line up choke line, pressure is double CLF
options.C: Pump seawater down choke line up riser
options.D: Pump mud down riser up choke line

questions.explanation: Pumping through both lines gives friction in BOTH. Total = 2× single line friction. Divide by 2 for CLF.

questions.question: On subsea BOP, what's the advantage of using kill line gauge vs casing pressure gauge during well kill?

options.A: Kill line gauge always more accurate
options.B: CLFL effect reduced to quarter on kill line
options.D: Maintaining constant KLP during pump changes compensates for CLFL

questions.explanation: Kill line gauge reads BOP pressure directly without CLFL effect. Holding constant KLP during pump rate changes automatically compensates for CLFL.

questions.question: What makes a vacuum degasser efficient? (TWO ANSWERS)

options.A: Gas cut mud flows in thin sheet over baffles
options.B: Gas cut mud flows in thick sheet over baffles

questions.explanation: Thin film maximizes surface area for gas release. Vacuum reduces pressure, causing dissolved gas to come out of solution.

questions.question: MGS max pressure with 12 ppg mud is 7 psi. Influx is gas and oil (7 ppg). What happens to MGS max pressure when returning fluid is oil and gas?
questions.explanation: Lighter oil (7 ppg vs 12 ppg) creates less hydrostatic in dip tube/liquid seal. Maximum working pressure decreases.

questions.question: What minimum pressure should annular pressure gauge be rated to?
questions.explanation: Annular regulators typically operate 0-1500 psi. Gauge should be rated 2× maximum = 3000 psi minimum.

questions.question: What pressure reading should be on annular pressure gauge while drilling?
questions.explanation: Annular is pre-set to closing pressure (typically 1500 psi max) ready for immediate closure.

questions.question: Match subsea emergency systems: EDS, Autoshear, Deadman to functions: (1) Disconnects LMRP from lower stack, (2) Closes shear rams in LMRP disconnect, (3) Closes shear rams if hydraulic/control lost to both pods.
questions.explanation: EDS separates LMRP. Deadman activates on loss of hydraulics AND communications. Autoshear triggers when LMRP physically separates.

questions.question: Which statements about SPM valves are true? (TWO ANSWERS)

options.C: Opened by spring force and seawater hydrostatic
options.E: Closed by spring force and seawater hydrostatic

questions.explanation: SPM valves: Pilot pressure OPENS them against spring. When pilot removed, spring + seawater hydrostatic CLOSES them (failsafe closed).

questions.question: Minimum pressure rating for fittings/gauges when testing a 13-5/8", 15000 psi BOP stack?
questions.explanation: Test equipment should be rated higher than test pressure. For 15000 psi BOP, use 20000 psi rated equipment.

questions.question: Rig with large surface line volume ignored while pumping kill mud to bit during W&W. Effect on BHP?
questions.explanation: If surface line volume ignored, kill mud reaches bit LATER than calculated. Lighter original mud stays in annulus longer = BHP lower than intended.

questions.question: After drawdown test on 15K BOP stack, which describes correct procedure?

options.B: Accumulator reads 1360 psi - use regulator to reduce to 1200 psi
options.D: Accumulator reads 1360 psi - refer to manufacturer data book and continue

questions.explanation: Post-drawdown pressure depends on specific accumulator design. Must verify against manufacturer specs.

questions.question: What's possible using inverted test rams in subsea BOP stack with blind/shear rams on top?

options.D: Pressure test wellhead side outlet valves

questions.explanation: Inverted test rams seal from above. Closing test rams and blind/shears creates isolated section including LMRP connector.
